CatDescriptText: Lee Randall, steelworker, North Side and English Burton, janitor, North Side, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that married students of high school age should be permitted to attend school with other students who are single?"  Lee Randal's answer reads: "I don't think that it would make any difference."  English Burton's answer reads: "It would make no difference.  They have to learn."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Lee Randall wearing eyeglasses, plaid shirt, and dark flecked overcoat, standing on sidewalk, Downtown; Portrait of English Burton wearing moustache, plaid shirt, and leather jacket, standing in front of store, Downtown
